verses.verse: So Abram <WH87> went <WH5927> up from Egypt <WH4714> to the Negev, <WH5045> he and his wife <WH802> and all <WH3605> that belonged to him; and Lot <WH3876> with him.
Now Abram <WH87> was very <WH3966> rich <WH3515> in livestock, <WH4735> in silver <WH3701> and in gold. <WH2091>

And he went <WH1980> on his journeys <WH4550> from the Negev <WH5045> as far <WH5704> as Bethel, <WH1008> to the place <WH4725> where <WH834> <WH8033> his tent <WH168> had been <WH1961> at the beginning, <WH8462> between <WH996> Bethel <WH1008> and Ai, <WH5857>

to the place <WH4725> of the altar, <WH4196> which <WH834> he had made <WH6213> there <WH8033> formerly; <WH7223> and there <WH8033> Abram <WH87> called <WH7121> on the name <WH8034> of the Lord. <WH3068>
Now Lot, <WH3876> who went <WH1980> with Abram, <WH87> also <WH1571> had <WH1961> flocks <WH6629> and herds <WH1241> and tents. <WH168>

And the land <WH776> could not sustain <WH5375> them while dwelling <WH3427> together; <WH9191> for their possessions <WH7399> were so great <WH7227> that they were not able <WH3201> to remain <WH3427> together. <WH9191>

And there was strife <WH7379> between <WH996> the herdsmen <WH7462> of Abram's livestock <WH4735> and the herdsmen <WH7462> of Lot's livestock. <WH4735> Now the Canaanite <WH3669> and the Perizzite <WH6522> were dwelling <WH3427> then <WH227> in the land. <WH776>

Then Abram <WH87> said <WH559> to Lot, <WH3876> "Please <WH4994> let there be no <WH408> strife <WH4808> between <WH996> you and me, nor between <WH996> my herdsmen <WH7462> and your herdsmen, <WH7462> for we are brothers. <WH251>

"Is not the whole <WH3605> land <WH776> before <WH6440> you? Please <WH4994> separate <WH6504> from me: if <WH518> [to] the left, <WH8040> then I will go <WH3231> to the right; <WH3231> or if <WH518> [to] the right, <WH3225> then I will go <WH8041> to the left. <WH8041>"

And Lot <WH3876> lifted <WH5375> up his eyes <WH5869> and saw <WH7200> all <WH3605> the valley <WH3603> of the Jordan, <WH3383> that it was well <WH4945> watered <WH4945> everywhere <WH3605> – [this was] before <WH6440> the Lord <WH3068> destroyed <WH7843> Sodom <WH5467> and Gomorrah <WH6017> – like the garden <WH1588> of the Lord, <WH3068> like the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> as you go <WH935> to Zoar. <WH6820>

So Lot <WH3876> chose <WH977> for himself all <WH3605> the valley <WH3603> of the Jordan; <WH3383> and Lot <WH3876> journeyed <WH5265> eastward. <WH6924> Thus they separated <WH6504> from each <WH376> other. <WH251>

Abram <WH87> settled <WH3427> in the land <WH776> of Canaan, <WH3667> while Lot <WH3876> settled <WH3427> in the cities <WH5892> of the valley, <WH3603> and moved <WH167> his tents <WH167> as far <WH5704> as Sodom. <WH5467>
Now the men <WH376> of Sodom <WH5467> were wicked <WH7451> exceedingly <WH3966> and sinners <WH2400> against the Lord. <WH3068>

And the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> to Abram, <WH87> after <WH310> Lot <WH3876> had separated <WH6504> from him, "Now <WH4994> lift <WH5375> up your eyes <WH5869> and look <WH7200> from the place <WH4725> where <WH834> <WH8033> you are, northward <WH6828> and southward <WH5045> and eastward <WH9506> and westward; <WH3220>
for all <WH3605> the land <WH776> which <WH834> you see, <WH7200> I will give <WH5414> it to you and to your descendants <WH2233> forever. <WH5704> <WH5769>

"And I will make <WH7760> your descendants <WH2233> as the dust <WH6083> of the earth; <WH776> so <WH834> that if <WH518> anyone <WH376> can <WH3201> number <WH4487> the dust <WH6083> of the earth, <WH776> then your descendants <WH2233> can also <WH1571> be numbered. <WH4487>
"Arise, <WH6965> walk <WH1980> about the land <WH776> through its length <WH753> and breadth; <WH7341> for I will give <WH5414> it to you."

Then Abram <WH87> moved <WH167> his tent <WH167> and came <WH935> and dwelt <WH3427> by the oaks <WH436> of Mamre, <WH4471> which <WH834> are in Hebron, <WH2275> and there <WH8033> he built <WH1129> an altar <WH4196> to the Lord. <WH3068>
